dialogues.text: Before BUBLIK gets to the arch the grenade goes off and knocks him back. He rolls backwards and falls off the led He just manages to grab on with one hand and dangles 30 f above the nave. JAN runs to the edge, leans down and grabs his arm, lifti him up. The Germans fire from the nave below. JAN is hit three times in the shoulder and arm. He falls backwards dropping his grip on BUBLIK. Wedged in the corner he is breathing hard. Shock on his f JAN stares at the now empty edge where BUBLIK was and is more. JAN turns onto his front and crawls through the last arch Another grenade lands behind him where he was slumped and goes off, showering him in debris.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHROPOID V20
dialogues.text: 150 151 JAN gets to the end wall - nowhere else to go. He loads h pistol with his last full magazine and fires at the oncom Germans through the arch. Hits three and misses just as many. CLICK. His gun empty, he reaches for his last single bullet and starts to load it into the clip. A German grenade bounces into his lap. His throws it over edge and into the nave. He cocks the weapon. A German standing in front of him screams:

dialogues.speaker: HALT
dialogues.text: JAN puts the gun to his temple and pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSEF, VALCIK, SVARC and HRUBY stand waiting anxiously. T single shot that still echoes has signalled the cease-fir All is now quiet. They look at each other. It’s obvious t it’s all over upstairs. Just the heavy silence now that betokens death. EXT. CATHEDRAL —- MORNING 151 The bodies of JAN, OPALKA and BUBLIK have been carried ou the church in rugs and laid on the pavement. PANNWITZ, KARL FRANK and many onlookers, including CURDA is pushed to the front to identify the men.

dialogues.speaker: CURDA
dialogues.text: This is Jan Kubis. (beat) That’s Adolf Opalka. (beat) Him, I don’t know, but its not Josef Gabcik or Valcik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four faces stare up from the darkness. Suddenly the flagstone is lifted up and light pours into crypt. Through the opening of the flagstone a German soldier is lowered down on rope.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHROPOID V20
dialogues.text: 152 JOSEF steps forward and opens fire with the Sten and hits soldier in the knee-caps. The soldier screams and is quickly hauled up by his comra The voice of PANNWITZ is then heard through a flagstone opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is in your own interests to give yourselves up peacefully. (beat) You have nothing to fear. The four are surprised and shocked by this announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This need not end in further bloodshed. PANNWITZ signals to the entrance and CURDA is dragged in the arm. There is a long silence. The men wait expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our patience can only be relied upon for a short time. We urge you to give yourselves up now peacefully. PANNWITZ urges CURDA to talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: CURDA
dialogues.text: Josef? You should surrender now and save yourselves. (beat) Do you hear me? (beat) You will be treated humanely as prisoners of war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSEF’S POV: CURDA is with two Gestapo officers.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEF
dialogues.text: That’s Curda!

dialogues.speaker: VALCIK
dialogues.text: Curda!?

dialogues.speaker: JOSEF
dialogues.text: Traitor! JOSEF opens fire with his Sten gun in CURDA’s direction. Germans take cover.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEF
dialogues.text: We are Czechs. We will never surrender! The Germans open fire with the machine guns opposite and chunks of masonry are churned out around opening of the c slit. JOSEF and the others are forced deeper into the crypt. EXT. CATHEDRAL —- MORNING 153 A German officer screams to halt the machine gun fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 154 Silence. The men regard each other. JOSEF takes four bull and distributes them among the men.

dialogues.speaker: JOSEF
dialogues.text: We save the last one for us. They all nod. Then two tear gas grenades are thrown into the crypt thro the vent. VALCIK quickly picks these up and throws them back on to street. EXT. CATHEDRAL —- MORNING 154 Firemen bring hoses and spot lights are placed to shine l into the crypt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large fireman’s hose is then thrown through the vent of crypt and gallons of water are pumped in. JOSEF climbs the ladder and struggles with the hose. He manages to push it out back on to the street. SVARC and HRUBY take up the tools and furiously attack th masonry hoping they can break through to the sewer. CLANG...CLANG...CLANG... JOSEF turns just in time to see a grappling hook catch th ladder by the slit high up on the wall at the end. JOSEF jumps to grab hold of the ladder but is too late an the ladder is yanked out through the slit to the street. There is no way now to stop the gallons of water pouring the crypt.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHROPOID V20
dialogues.text: 155 The fireman’s hose is put through the slit again and wate gushes into the crypt again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plans for the cathedral have been discovered and are being studied by Germans. Carpets are pulled up and a large concrete slab covering main stairs into the crypt is found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 Gallons of water pour into the crypt. HRUBY and SVARC continue feverishly hammering at the maso Water rises and washes over a burning candle extinguishin its flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Germans chisel detonators into the concrete slab and the trigger wire away to a safe distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSEF wades towards the SVARC and HRUBY when suddenly the is a very loud explosion at the back of the crypt and the shock wave throws JOSEF into the now deep water. Brief underwater shot and the SOUND FADES AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: OF THE SITUATION.
dialogues.text: JOSEF comes up for air and turns. A cloud of dust envelop the crypt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Germans have blasted a bricked-up entrance at the bac top part of the crypt. Underneath the blast hole are ston steps leading down into the crypt. HRUBY and SVARC continue feverishly hammering at the maso HRUBY stops chiselling the masonry and turns to face JOSE and VALCIK. JOSEF and VALCIK look over at HRUBY. HRUBY'’s face, soaking wet, void of hope. He shakes his h There is no escape into to the sewers. It’s hopeless. VALCIK throws a spare pistol at HRUBY.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHROPOID V20
dialogues.text: HRUBY catches it, cocks it. SVARC takes his pistol from his belt and clocks it. They all turn to the steps that lead up to the blast hole take up defensive positions. Two German soldiers run down the stone stairs into the cr JOSEF wades forward and fires his pistols twice. A hand-grenade is thrown into the crypt and falls into th waist-level water at the bottom of the steps. It explodes The water absorbs most of the blast but a massive plume o water is thrown up drenching the men. Two more German soldiers come down the steps. VALCIK opens fire killing them but the Sten gun clicks em He throws it into the water and takes his pistol from his belt. Another grenade hits the water. The men take cover. The water explodes upwards. Another German takes the stairs down into the crypt. HRUBY fires till his gun clicks empty. JOSEF shakes his head in resignation and takes the single bullet from his breast pocket. He holds his open palm outstretched toward the other three men. They all take a single round from their pockets. They com together. Four palms each open with a bullet. JOSEF clenches his fist around the bullet. The others do same. The four fists are an eloquent symbol of strength a resistance. The chambers of the weapons are loaded and clocked. They smile sadly. Then all four place the guns to their temples. Close up of JOSEF. A German has got down the first two steps and fires his machine gun at them. Two are slightly hit but then shoot themselves so there i chance of being taken alive. BANG. BANG. BANG. In the cross-fire HRUBY, VALCIK and SVARC fall into the water. Close up of JOSEF, the gun at his temple - looking straig ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHROPOID V20
dialogues.text: A split second of silence. FLASH FRAMES of the back of LENKA’s head. Hair gently blo in the wind. CAMERA Slowly tracks in to her. LENKA’s dead hand hangs limp. Blood dripping from the fingertips. JOSEF’s POV: LENKA standing opposite him. Wet, pale, ange Up to her waist in water. A white lace dress hugs her ele figure and flows in the water around her. She smiles. Close up of JOSEF’s eyes. They seem to briefly smile. BANG. The water from the hose continues to pour into the crypt. The German soldiers walk down the steps, guns at the read The bodies of JOSEF, VALCIK, HRUBY and SVARC float in the swirling waters. Close up of the PHOTO of LENKA floating on the surface of water. It swirls around with other floating debris until sinks below the surface and fades from view in the darkne

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: Josef Gabcik Jan Kubis Adolf Opalka Josef Valcik Jaroslav Svarc Josef Bublik Jan Hrubry The seven parachutists held the church for 6 hours.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: Four months before his assassination, Reinhard Heydrich attended a secret meeting in Wannsee to finalise the Nazi policy of Jewish extermination. Heydrich is considered to be one of leading architects of Final Solution to the Jewish ‘question’.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: The Czechoslovak Government-in-exile considered the assassination of Heydrich as an act of retribution and a clear sign that Czechoslovakia was still resisting Nazi r It was also meant to send a clear message to the Nazis th none of them were untouchable and could be made to answer their actions at anytime.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHROPOID V20
dialogues.text: It was an important message but sent at great cost to th Czech people. In the aftermath of the assassination over 5000 Czech men women and children were executed by the SS. For helping in the assassination, Marie Kovarnikovd, reportedly pregnant with Jan's child, was executed at Mauthausen concentration camp on 24 October, 1942.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: The traitor Karel Curda was arrested by the Czech authori in 1945 and hanged two years later for treason.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: Vanek Ladislav was arrested by the Gestapo on 4th Septemb 1942. He gave up many of the names associated with the Ji resistance group and survived the war as a prisoner at Gestapo headquarters. After the war he became a collaborator for the Czechoslov state police (StB) and informed on anticommunist activiti The accounts of his part played in the assassination of Reinhard Heydrich have subsequently been challenged.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: After the assassination and the bloody reprisals committe the Nazis on Czech citizens, Winston Churchill declared t Munich Agreement null and void and counted Czechoslovakia an important ally in the fight for freedom.
